messages.message:
1. b. cc @Elan Sharony on doc_id—can you confirm if this is a bug, or is doc_id only populated in certain cases? related PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/58429)
2. This needs to be implemented and picked up from v1 flow results please create a ticket, can be included in include_review_results (https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/get-run-results#request.query.include_review_results) edit history

1. . 
    a. The `docid = null` (see my JSON output result I attached) @hannah 
    b. same as a
    c. Thanks this will be useful
2. Agree - we have this in the UI but not in the API results so seems like an obvious improvement to make. @hannah 
3. Will create a ticket
@hannah on 1.b.i - how do I use this customisability? How can all results be optional when I don't see options to turn these on and off (unless I'm missing something which I could well be)

@Anil I'd be interested to know what `doc_id` actually looks like. Is there a way to match the UI to API results (+ to storage facility in the long run) using this ID? Or is the ID the doc name e.g. 'test PDF (page 1-5)'?

tagging @Chris Cowell on the docs questions. He’s been working on a revision of these docs, so it’s possible those are already being addressed?
> 
>     a. In the docs here (https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/get-run-results#response), it looks like there should be the keys `post_processed_paths` and `doc_id` . I don’t see the former in the response, and the latter is null for all docs
>         i. Why are all result keys marked as optional in the docs? It looks like they are just all returned maybe? @jean
>     b. Can I link the results back to the split up PDF via e.g. connected drive? What if I’d like to download the split files and results to store/use somewhere (e.g. customer is recreating HR screen)?
>

For historical context @Hamish - here is is the tech spec. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ejXiAS4XeL_1i5FJxEww8GUWCk9v2I8mWp5h_2gAzNg/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.utgy99vkwwrj

For using the parameters this is how `GET /api/v2/apps/runs/<RUN_ID>/results?<QUERY_PARAMS>.` For example in the documentation it has: `curl "${API_ROOT}/v2/apps/runs/<RUN-ID>/results?include_confidence_scores=true&include_source_info=true" \>`

Separately. I've created two tickets:
• One for the bugs (lack of post-processed paths + doc ID): https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3193
• One for the improvements (page numbers & original value for edit history) : https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-3194
@Hamish feel free to add additional context to either of those tickets
I’ll take a look at this thread and see if we need docs updates. Will post findings here.

I chatted with @Elan Sharony
The doc ID - not sure why we expose it as there are no APIs that can use it. It is null - which is a bug. Elan will take a look into it (EPD-3193)

Will work with @Abhishek Adupa to expose page numbers.
